result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago

defendant.name: Penagos Santiago, Edgar Leonardo
defendant.address: 5707 W Carlsville Rd #113, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.addlTxt: Atty Van Rite Case Completion Letter
11:24 AM.  State moves to dismiss charges upon plea in case 22CF33 and 21CF87.  Court so orders, dismisses charges but reads in for sentencing.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

11:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago in court, in custody.  Attorney Brittany Van Rite in court for Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.
Lorena Mongin will interpret in person for 8/09/22 hearing.

11:05 AM   Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brittany Van Rite appeared by video for Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago. Lorena Mongin sworn, interprets via zoom for defendant. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Atty Van Rite requests cash bond be converted to a signature bond.  State opposes request.  Court not changing bond, remains in effect as previously set. Atty Van Rite questions whether Court would consider amending bond if defendant is accepted into a treatment program.  If defendant is accepted into a treatment program, Court would then consider amending bond. Atty Van Rite indicates they hope to resolve all pending matters at 8/09/22 hearing.  Court requests interpreter be present in person for 8/09/22 hearing.  Lorena Mongin will be present in court in person on 8/09/22.  Bond remains in effect. 
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:20 am.
Initial appearance on June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Lorena Mongin will interpret via zoom for 6/24/22 hearing at 11 AM.    Zoom instructions emailed to Lorena.
9:15 AM    Court could not connect to zoom   After talking to CCAP, Zoom is out nationwide.  Court will have JA Wiegand reschedule hearing.  Interpreter cancelled via email.

ADDRESS INFO for Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago
Current: 5707 W Carlsville Rd #113, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235   (Effective: 06-20-2022)
Prior: 5707 W Carlsville Rd #1, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

1:00 pm.  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Shannon Viel appeared by video for Edgar Leonardo Penagos Santiago. Bruce Goodman sworn, interprets via zoom for defendant. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return  6/21/22 at 9:00 am, Br. 2.
